com.cloudera.oryx.rdf.common.rule

Class Decision

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cloudera.oryx.rdf.common.rule.Decision
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CategoricalDecision, NumericDecision

    public abstract class Decision
extends Object
    Subclasses represent a binary yes/no positive/negative decision based on the value of a feature in an example. This can be a numeric feature or a categorical feature.
    Author:
    Sean Owen
    See Also:
    NumericDecision, CategoricalDecision

    • Method Detail

      • getFeatureNumber

        public final int getFeatureNumber()
        Returns:
        number of the feature whose value the Decision operates on

      • getInformationGain

        public final double getInformationGain()
        Returns:
        information gain that the Decision gives rise to (on the training set used to build the model); this is not set until the Decision is evaluated

      • setInformationGain

        public final void setInformationGain(double informationGain)

      • isPositive

        public abstract boolean isPositive(Example example)
        Parameters:
        example - example to evaluate Decision on
        Returns:
        true iff the Decision is positive on this example

      • getDefaultDecision

        public abstract boolean getDefaultDecision()
        Returns:
        default decision -- true means positive -- when the Decision cannot be evaluated on an Example because the feature value it decides on is missing

      • getType

        public abstract FeatureType getType()
        Returns:
        type of feature the Decision is over (a FeatureType)

      • decisionsFromExamples

        public static List<Decision> decisionsFromExamples(ExampleSet examples,
                                   int featureNumber,
                                   int suggestedMaxSplitCandidates)
        Parameters:
        examples - ExampleSet of data to create Decisions over
        featureNumber - which feature to decide on
        suggestedMaxSplitCandidates - a suggested maximum number of Decisions to return
        Returns:
        a List of Decisions to evaluate
